oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Program to D. W. Griffith's film "Birth of a Nation" featuring a cast list; plot summary and technical facts concerning the film; photos of Griffith and the cast; stills from the film's scenes, including battles, celebrations, and the surrender at Appomattox; and various essays on the film and its importance.

D. W. Griffith's "Birth of a Nation" was based on Thomas Dixon's novel "The Clansman," and featured a highly romanticized and specious portrayal of the period of Reconstruction that followed the Civil War. The film pioneered new film-making techniques, such as close ups, deep focus, and jump cuts. The highest grossing film of all time until 1937, its popularity helped cause a resurgence of the KKK in response to the Klan's positive portrayal in the film.
